monologue: speech you make to yourself; a long utterance by one person (especially one that prevents others from participating in the conversation; a (usually long
easier said than done: easy to say, hard to execute
user: a person who makes use of a thing; someone who uses or employs something; a person who uses something or someone selfishly or unethically; a person who takes drugs
euphemism: an inoffensive or indirect expression that is substituted for one that is considered offensive or too harsh
phenomenon: any state or process known through the senses rather than by intuition or reasoning; a remarkable development
